item.title: Apparently abandoned vehicle, 4th October
item.description:
That is a vehicle. Apparently abandoned at the far end of Old Reddings Road, Cheltenham, where it becomes the path alongside the park (sometimes known as the "Humpty dumps"). Reg OY58 BFJ, dark Volvo estate. It has been there about a week so I wondered if abandoned or stolen and dumped.

item.title: Cycle path closed/cyclists dismount here signs - but cycle lane clearly open, 4th October
item.description:
Signs placed closing the cycle lane and advising cyclists to dismount. I chose to use the road as requested and was subject to abuse by motorists along this section. Could the signs be removed or swapped for ‘cyclists rejoin carriageway’ if the cycle lane is clear please.

item.title: Request for Extension of Yellow Line Markings to Improve Safety and Emergency Access, 4th October
item.description:
Top of barley road, the first island, near new barn lane. This has been an ongoing issue since the yellow lines were painted on earlier this year. I am writing to raise a safety concern regarding the current layout of road markings near [insert specific location or junction name]. The existing yellow lines terminate too early before the traffic island, which results in vehicles being forced to bypass the island on the wrong side of the road. This creates a significant hazard and obstructs the passage of emergency vehicles, which would otherwise have to mount or cross the island to proceed — posing risks to both the vehicle and road users. According to the Traffic Signs Regulations and General Directions (TSRGD) 2016, yellow line restrictions (no waiting or no loading) must be positioned so that they clearly convey the extent of the restriction and maintain safe, unobstructed access for traffic. In this instance, the current termination point does not adequately prevent obstruction nor ensure a clear passage for emergency response vehicles, as required under Section 130 of the Highways Act 1980, which places a duty on highway authorities to assert and protect the rights of the public to the use and enjoyment of the highway. I respectfully request that the double yellow lines be extended beyond the island to ensure: Vehicles can remain fully on the correct side of the carriageway; Emergency vehicles can pass safely without mounting kerbs or traffic islands; and Compliance with visibility and obstruction standards as set out in the Design Manual for Roads and Bridges (DMRB), CD 169 – Traffic Signs and Road Markings. I would appreciate an inspection of the site and a confirmation that this matter will be reviewed under the authority’s road safety and maintenance obligations. Thank you for your attention to this issue again. I look forward to your response.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Barley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Three potholes near the riding school area, 3rd October
item.description:
Residents are asking if we are going to fix the 3 large potholes on New Road whilst Severn Trent close the road to repair the burst water main. 3rd to 8th October. The three pots were reported on FixMyStreet last month there is a lot of local concern. You can't miss them as they are getting bigger every day.
